bioghist.p: Ernest Hexamer was a civil engineer and surveyor. Hexamer along with William Locher introduced a series of insurance maps of Philadelphia in 1857. Their series was continued, with enlargements, until 1915, when the Hexamer and Sanborn companies merged.

scopecontent.p: The surveys, prepared between 1865 and 1899, document industrial sites in the Philadelphia area with perspective drawings, plot plans, and detailed textual description of the products and operations of the plants. They include surveys of carpet, woolen, and cotton mills, brick works, dye works, iron works, glass works, and breweries. Companies represented in the volumes include Aramingo Chemical Works, Baldwin Locomotive, Fairmount Woolen Mills, Hortsman's Dress Trimmings Factory, Lagrange Print Works, Phoenix Iron Works, United States Hotel, and William Wood and Co.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
